metadata.title: CVE-2021-25219 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In BIND 9.3.0 -> 9.11.35, 9.12.0 -> 9.16.21, and versions 9.9.3-S1 ->9.11.35-S1 and 9.16.8-S1 -> 9.16.21-S1 of BIND Supported Preview Edition,as well as release versions 9.17.0 -> 9.17.18 of the BIND 9.17 developmentbranch, exploitation of broken authoritative servers using a flaw inresponse processing can cause degradation in BIND resolver performance. Theway the lame cache is currently designed makes it possible for its internaldata structures to grow almost infinitely, which may cause significantdelays in client query processing.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-25219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm5').
